channel.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
channel.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

image.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
image.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

item.title: UN raises concern over Haitian gangs’ recruitment of children
item.description: Thousands of people have been displaced and dozens killed as gang violence escalates in Haiti's capital, officials say.

item.title: With US poised to restrict abortion, other countries ease access
item.description: US top court may soon overturn landmark abortion rights ruling, but courts in other nations are moving to do opposite.

item.title: Ukraine live news: Russia facing ‘stiff’ fight in Donbas, US says
item.description: Progress of Russia's military campaign in eastern Ukraine is slow due to 'stiff Ukrainian resistance', Pentagon says.

item.title: Russia pounds Ukraine, targeting supply of Western arms
item.description: Kyiv says Russia intensifying its assault with attacks reported on railway stations used to transport Western arms.

item.title: Are Sweden and Finland under threat?
item.description: The two Nordic countries say they will apply to join the NATO transatlantic military alliance.

item.title: Roe v Wade: Anti-abortion push rocks reputation of top US court
item.description: Legal experts say likely overturning of Roe v Wade would show Supreme Court justices are 'politicians wearing robes'.

item.title: US stocks soar as Fed’s Powell quells fear of bigger hikes
item.description: The S&P 500 rose 3%, Nasdaq 100 jumped 3.4% while the Dow Jones Industrial Average gained 2.8%.

item.title: Anger at Greek court verdict over LGBTQ activist killing
item.description: LGBTQ activists denounce acquittal of police officers who had been charged over killing of a queer activist in Athens.

item.title: Guinea issues charges against deposed leader Alpha Conde
item.description: The charges against the 84-year-old former president and his allies include complicity in murder and assault.

item.title: In their words: US Supreme Court justices’ records on abortion
item.description: A 6-3 conservative majority on the US's top court appears prepared to reverse precedents allowing abortion.

item.title: Elon Musk asked by UK Parliament to discuss plans to buy Twitter
item.description: The Parliament's digital committee asked the Tesla CEO to give evidence about his proposals 'in more depth'.

item.title: Fed raises rates half-point as Powell signals similar moves ahead
item.description: That is the biggest move from the US central bank since 2000.

item.title: New Mexico wildfire burns through ‘sacred land’
item.description: More than 10,000 people have been evacuated from their homes after the large fire tore through centuries-old villages.

item.title: What you should know about the EU plan to ban Russian oil imports
item.description: The European Commission has proposed a plan to phase out imports of Russian crude and refined oil.

item.title: ‘The bottom line’: Biden touts falling US budget deficit
item.description: US President Joe Biden took aim at what he dubbed 'MAGA' Republicans who he charged with protecting billionaires.

item.title: TurboTax pays $141m to settle claims it duped consumers
item.description: Intuit will pay US customers who were deceived by misleading promises of free tax-filing services.

item.title: Abortion rights take centre stage in US midterm election year
item.description: Democratic politicians expect a pending Supreme Court decision to prompt their voters to 'rise up' and 'fight'.

item.title: No Ukraine ceasefire deal without Russian withdrawal: Zelenskyy
item.description: Ukrainian president says he will not accept a deal that would allow Russian troops to remain in occupied territory.

item.title: Hariri’s absence leaves Sunni voters unsure ahead of Lebanon poll
item.description: Experts say Saad Hariri’s absence from upcoming Lebanese election created a 'political void' for the Sunni community.

item.title: Seven dead in attack on Chibok community in northeast Nigeria
item.description: Chibok first came to the limelight when Boko Haram abducted about 200 schoolgirls from the community's school in 2014.

item.title: After Roe leak, WHO’s Tedros says safe abortions ‘save lives’
item.description: WHO chief did not directly reference leaked US Supreme Court draft opinion indicating Roe v Wade may soon be overturned.

item.title: Debating the debate over the Russian war in Ukraine
item.description: Weaponising the media normalises war and undermines democracy.

item.title: US trade deficit hits record as goods imports surge
item.description: The gap in goods and services trade grew 22.3 percent to $109.8bn, the Commerce Department has said.

item.title: Somalia: AU says Burundi peacekeepers killed in al-Shabab attack
item.description: The African Union and the Burundian army commented on the attack, breaking from tradition.

item.title: Europe’s Russia oil embargo risks flaring already hot inflation
item.description: Most Eastern European countries still depend on Russia for more than half of their crude imports.
